title: In pictures: People march for abortion rights
description: People across the United States marched on Saturday, October 2, in support of reproductive rights.

title: Canadian citizen and English narrator of ISIS recruitment videos in US custody
description: An English-speaking narrator of ISIS recruitment videos is in custody in the US and charged with conspiring to help the terrorist organization, the Justice Department announced on Saturday.

title: Supreme Court justices take on critics in rare public remarks
description: Five of the nine Supreme Court justices made a notable series of rare public opinions, striking a provocative tone while off the bench. CNN's Jessica Schneider reports new polling shows the lowest approval rating for the Supreme Court in decades.

title: What we learned in Elizabeth Holmes trial
description: The trial of Theranos founder Elizabeth Holmes concluded its fourth week on Friday, with the lengthiest witness testimony of the trial so far.

title: Jim Acosta to Fox News host: Viewers may soon not be around to listen to your lies
description: CNN's Jim Acosta explains the consequences of Fox News host Tucker Carlson and far-right personalities spreading coronavirus misinformation.

title: A body believed to be Miya Marcano has been found
description: Authorities have found a body believed to be 19-year-old Miya Marcano, the Orange County, Florida, sheriff said in a news conference Saturday, just over a week after she was last seen.

title: Adele fans think the artist may have a new album on the way
description: Adele fans think the singer has a new album coming. And they may be right.

title: 'I am both tickled and horrified': Reporter reacts to UK game show
description: This week on "Pop Off," CNN reporter Lisa Respers France talks about Hollywood's obsession with true crime stories. Subscribe to Lisa's "Pop Life Chronicles" newsletter here.

title: Sing a song of freedom with 'Diana: The Musical' and more
description: With Britney Spears' conservatorship battle back in the news this week, it seems appropriate to reflect on the dark side of celebrity.

title: Donald Trump ratchets up demands on Gov. Greg Abbott to review Texas election results
description: Former President Donald Trump is ramping up pressure on Texas Gov. Greg Abbott to allow an election review bill to move forward in a state he won in 2020 -- as Trump continues his election fraud crusade nearly a year after losing the White House.

title: Stelter: This is the real reason Trump wants back on Twitter
description: CNN's Brian Stelter says that former President Donald Trump is suing to get back onto Twitter because Trump clearly believes he needs Twitter in order to run for President in 2024.

title: Video of Fox News' studio paints a different picture than what hosts say on TV
description: A video of the new Fox News studio in DC captured top talent and leaders at the network all wearing masks. CNN's Brian Stelter says this is telling because many of the network's top hosts rail against mask-wearing.

title: John Kerry says emissions cuts are 'do-able' as ministers wrap last meeting ahead of COP26
description: US climate envoy John Kerry said Saturday that global targets to slash greenhouse gas emissions are "do-able," striking an optimistic tone at the end of final high-level meeting before the COP26 international climate talks in Glasgow next month.

title: 10-year-old dies of Covid-19 just days after contracting virus
description: Nicole and Jeff Sperry are mourning their 10-year-old daughter who died just days after contracting Covid-19. They remember their daughter's life and remind others that the virus should still be taken seriously.

title: Lizzie Deignan makes history by winning first women's Paris Roubaix
description: Britain's Lizzie Deignan rode to a landmark victory in the inaugural Paris Roubaix Femmes as rain, mud and crashes made it a memorable debut for the world's best female riders over the infamous cobbled course on Saturday.

title: Search for missing New Jersey woman heads to California desert
description: New Jersey native Lauren Cho has been missing since late June while she was staying at an Airbnb in southern California outside of Los Angeles. CNN's Natasha Chen reports.

title: The original lead singer of Van Halen has announced his retirement
description: David Lee Roth, the original lead singer of Van Halen, has announced his retirement in an interview with the Las Vegas Review-Journal.

title: Pakistani comedian Umer Sharif dies at age 66 in Germany
description: Pakistani comedian and actor Umer Sharif died Saturday at the age of 66 in Germany.

title: Mars robots take cruise control during solar event
description: Everyone needs a break.

title: 2021 has 'not been a good year for peacemaking.' But WHO is tipped for the Nobel Peace Prize
description: After 18 turbulent months spent tackling the global Covid-19 pandemic, the World Health Organization (WHO) is being broadly tipped as the frontrunner to take this year's Nobel Peace Prize.

title: 5 things about Melania Trump revealed in Stephanie Grisham's new book
description: During her five years working in various roles as a senior aide to Donald and Melania Trump, Stephanie Grisham had perhaps the most intimate vantage point of their time in the White House.

title: States are drawing new election maps. Here's what to know
description: Here's the first of a number of stories we'll write between now and the end of the year on the most important element of US politics that most Americans don't spend too much time worrying about: redistricting.

title: Police failure to tackle violence against women 'infuriating,' UK PM Boris Johnson says
description: UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson has described the police's failure to take violence against women and girls sufficiently seriously as "infuriating," in an interview with British newspaper The Times after the killing of Sarah Everard and more than 100 other women in Britain this year.

title: Covid-19 antiviral pill could be a game changer, but vaccines are still America's way out of the pandemic, experts say
description: A pill that could potentially treat Covid-19 is a "game-changer," but experts are emphasizing that it's not an alternative to vaccinations -- which remain the most effective path to ending the coronavirus pandemic if enough people get their shots.

title: Japan, Australia and Argentina reveal reopening plans
description: Check out CNN's latest weekly news update on pandemic travel. Japan, Australia and Argentina have eased their Covid travel restrictions for October and November.

title: He's the most popular man on TikTok. And he doesn't say a word
description: When Italy first went into a coronavirus lockdown last year, Khabane Lame had just lost his job at a factory near the northern city of Turin.

title: Teenage skateboard sensation saddened by plight of Afghan girls
description: Sky Brown became Great Britain's youngest ever Olympic medalist this summer -- now, she wants to encourage young girls worldwide to find their own success.

title: How often should you wash your towels?
description: There is nothing like wrapping yourself up in a fluffy, warm towel after a hot shower or bath.

title: Ready-to-eat spices and food additives exposed to widespread rodent infestation were seized by the FDA
description: FDA-regulated spices and food additive products exposed to "widespread rodent infestation" as well as live and dead insects, were seized in Miami on Friday by the US Marshals Service on behalf of the US Food and Drug Administration, according to an FDA statement.

title: China sends more than three dozen warplanes in skies near Taiwan in largest incursion yet
description: China sent 38 warplanes into the skies around Taiwan on Friday, the highest number of Chinese military aircraft to breach the island's Air Defense Identification Zone in a single day since Taipei began publicly reporting such activities last year, Tawain's Defense Ministry said Friday night.

title: Singapore hits highest daily number of Covid-19 cases since the start of the pandemic
description: Singapore's Ministry of Health reported 2,909 new Covid-19 cases on Friday, the highest number of daily infections in the city-state since the start of the pandemic.

title: Boris Johnson's reign is becoming one long crisis
description: On Sunday, Boris Johnson will walk among his Conservative faithful for the first time since October 2019, as members of the UK's governing party gather in the English city of Manchester for their 2021 conference.

title: Belarusian strongman Alexander Lukashenko tries to turn the tables in combative interview
description: Alexander Lukashenko must be familiar by now with the sound of people who disagree with him. The Belarusian capital of Minsk was thronged with massive protests before and after the disputed presidential election in August 2020, which was marred by fraud. Lukashenko says he won anyway, but the US, EU and Belarusian opposition challenge that.

title: US women's soccer league cancels matches over sexual misconduct claims against coach
description: The National Women's Soccer League has called off all matches scheduled for this weekend following a report Thursday by The Athletic detailing allegations of sexual coercion and misconduct against Paul Riley, who coached three NWSL teams over eight seasons.

title: Man selling catalytic convertor online left a bag of meth in the photo, sheriff's office says
description: A man selling a catalytic convertor on Facebook Marketplace left a large bag of methamphetamine and a syringe on the coffee table in the background of the picture he posted, the Stone County Sheriff's Office in Missouri said in a post on Facebook.

title: Britain's royal family loves James Bond. There are a few reasons for that
description: There are premieres and there are royal premieres, and Bond is the only movie franchise able to guarantee a blue-blooded red-carpet appearance. Not one but two palace limousines pulled up at the Royal Albert Hall this week to deliver the first and second in line to the throne and their spouses.

title: Foreign investors are losing out in Evergrande's battle to survive
description: The endgame for Evergrande is still up in the air. But the troubled Chinese conglomerate is starting to get its priorities in order — and foreign investors look to be bottom of the list.

title: Australia's climate policy is being dictated by a former accountant in a cowboy hat
description: Australia's Prime Minister has all but confirmed he won't join global leaders at crucial climate talks in Glasgow.

title: Mercury mission succeeds in flyby for the first time
description: Mercury, the smallest planet in our solar system, is all set for a rendezvous with a spacecraft.
